policy_statement.purpose: To establish standards for identifying and remediating source code vulnerabilities through static analysis.
policy_statement.description: This policy defines requirements for SAST implementation, vulnerability management, and secure code development practices.
policy_statement.applicability: All development teams and applications with custom source code.
policy_statement.enforcement: Mandatory SAST scans in CI/CD pipeline with quality gates that block promotion of code containing findings above the defined severity threshold.
policy_statement.exceptions: Legacy applications may request temporary exemptions through the Security Review Board, provided a risk‑based justification and compensating controls are documented.

executive_summary: The current code base exhibits critical and high‑severity vulnerabilities that could lead to unauthorized data access and system compromise. Immediate remediation of hard‑coded credentials and SQL injection flaws, combined with a continuous SAST program, will substantially reduce the organization’s attack surface.
scope: Application source code security analysis for all in‑house and third‑party developed applications.
objectives: Integrate automated SAST tooling into every build pipeline.
Ensure timely remediation of findings based on severity and business impact.
Maintain a measurable reduction in code‑level risk over time.

risk_assessment.business_impact: Exploitation of hard‑coded credentials could provide attackers with privileged access to production environments, while SQL injection could lead to data breach, loss of integrity, and regulatory penalties.

security_controls.title: Input Validation Framework
security_controls.description: Implement a centralized input validation library that enforces whitelist validation for all external data.
implementation_steps: Select a vetted validation library (e.g., OWASP ESAPI).
Integrate the library into all data‑ingress points (controllers, APIs).
Enforce parameterized queries for database access.
Add unit tests that verify validation rules for each input field.

security_controls.title: Secret Management
security_controls.description: Remove hard‑coded secrets from source code and store them in a centralized secret vault.
implementation_steps: Identify all occurrences of hard‑coded credentials using SAST rules.
Migrate secrets to a vault solution (e.g., HashiCorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager).
Update application code to retrieve secrets at runtime via secure APIs.
Rotate secrets quarterly and after any incident.

security_controls.title: Continuous SAST Monitoring
security_controls.description: Run SAST scans on every commit and nightly full scans to detect new or re‑introduced vulnerabilities.
implementation_steps: Configure the CI/CD pipeline to trigger SAST on pull‑request validation.
Fail the build if any finding is classified as Critical or High.
Schedule nightly full repository scans and archive results for trend analysis.
Integrate scan results with the ticketing system for automated assignment.

security_controls.title: Vulnerability Remediation Workflow
security_controls.description: Define a prioritized remediation process aligned with severity and business impact.
implementation_steps: Create remediation tickets automatically from SAST findings.
Assign tickets based on ownership (e.g., Backend Team, DevOps).
Track remediation status in the security dashboard.
Conduct post‑remediation verification scans before ticket closure.

remediation_actions.title: Fix critical hard‑coded credentials
remediation_actions.success_criteria: All credentials are removed from source code and retrieved securely from the approved secret vault; no hard‑coded secrets remain in any repository.

remediation_actions.title: Remediate SQL Injection in login form
remediation_actions.success_criteria: All database interactions in the login flow use prepared statements or ORM parameter binding; SAST scan shows no SQL injection findings for the affected file.

remediation_actions.title: Clean up unused import statements
remediation_actions.success_criteria: Static analysis reports zero low‑severity unused import findings; code quality metrics improve.

monitoring_requirements: Automated SAST scans on every commit and nightly full repository scans.
Dashboard reporting of open findings by severity and age.
Weekly security code review meetings to validate remediation progress.
review_schedule: Quarterly policy review and annual audit
